page.title: 12FORTHAMPTON FETE
page.content: The annual Forthampton fete was held on Saturday 31 August 1985 in the gardens of the Court. This, and the annual Fun Run are the only significant events on the Forthampton calendar. The money raised at the fete goes to the church. There were a few stalls selling home-grown produce, pots of jam and cakes and a skittle alley. It was also possible to be taken on a tour of the house. In all there were about sixty people at the fete and the majority of these were in the older age ranges. Here is further evidence of the population imbalance in the village. The fete also showed how the community draws even closer together for such an event. Many of those living in the village ran the stalls and it can be assumed that almost everyone knew each other.
